definitions.definition: bring and hand over (a letter, parcel, or ordered goods) to the proper recipient or address.
examples: the products should be delivered on time
synonyms: remit "the parcel was delivered to his house"hand over
trust "the money was delivered up to the official"

examples: they would have delivered him to the Germans for vengeance

definitions.definition: launch or aim (a blow, a ball, or an attack).
examples: the pitcher winds up to deliver the ball
synonyms: give; Moreinformalland "she delivered a deadly blow to his head"throw

examples: he had been able to deliver votes in huge numbers
synonyms: furnish More"the trip delivered everything she wanted"fulfill
make good on "we must deliver on our commitments"

definitions.definition: save, rescue, or set free from.
synonyms: redeem "he was delivered from his enemies"

examples: to deliver up to justice a member of his own family

definitions.definition: acknowledge that one intends to be bound by (a deed), either explicitly by declaration or implicitly by formal handover.

examples: the President will deliver a speech
synonyms: set forth "the court delivered its verdict"

definitions.definition: (of a judge or court) give (a judgment or verdict).

examples: the village midwife delivered the baby
the number of women delivering their babies in hospitals increased
synonyms: birth; Moreinformaldrop; datedbe delivered of "she returned home to deliver her child"

examples: she was delivered of her second child
